abstract: Manhattan Judge Katherine B Forrest orders United States Parole Commission to explain its reasons for tracking movements and computer activity of Jonathan L Pollard, Cold War era spy who has been released after serving 30 years of life sentence for espionage; Pollard's lawyers say restrictions, including ankle tracker, place undue hardship on him.
lead_paragraph: The United States Parole Commission was ordered to provide a fuller explanation of its reasons for electronically tracking the movements of Mr. Pollard, convicted of spying for Israel during the Cold War.

headline.main: Tracking of Jonathan Pollard, a Paroled Spy, Requires More Explanation, Judge Says
headline.print_headline: Judge Orders Explanation for Tracking of Paroled Spy

snippet: The United States Parole Commission was ordered to provide a fuller explanation of its reasons for electronically tracking the movements of Mr. Pollard, convicted of spying for Israel during the Cold War.
